Description: SunCoke Energy Inc. and two of its subsidiaries have agreed to pay $1.995 million to resolve alleged Clean Air Act violations of emission limits at the Gateway Energy and Coke plant in Granite City, Illinois, and the Haverhill Coke plant in Franklin Furnace, Ohio, announced the Justice Department and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/united-states-reaches-agreement-suncoke-energy-resolving-clean-air-violations-plants-illinois

Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/united-states-and-indiana-reach-agreement-suncoke-energy-and-cokenergy-resolve-clean-air-act

Description: SunCoke agreed to pay $575,000 to Illinois and $150,000 to Ohio to resolve Clean Air Act violations. This was part of a larger $102 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-suncoke-energy-inc
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/united-states-reaches-agreement-suncoke-energy-resolving-clean-air-violations-plants-illinois

Description: SunCoke Energy and Cokenergy agreed to pay $2.5 million to the state to resolve alleged environmental violations at an East Chicago plant. The announcement did not indicate how much each would pay. Here we assume the amount was divided equally between the two. This was part of a larger $5.25 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-suncoke-energy-inc-0
Info Source: https://calendar.in.gov/site/oag/event/ag-curtis-hill-announces-settlement-following-alleged-environmental-violations-at-east-chicago-plant/
